pillars.name: Clear, Purposeful Structure
pillars.goal: Reduce cognitive load by organizing content from simple to complex and chunking information step-by-step.

principles.name: Small segments
principles.rule: Break learning content into small, manageable segments to support step-by-step processing.
checks: Is content chunked into bite-sized units?
Does each screen/page have a single primary idea?

principles.name: Self-contained segments
principles.rule: Design units/modules to stand alone meaningfully with minimal dependency on other content.
checks: Can a learner understand the segment without hunting elsewhere?

principles.name: Logical sequencing
principles.rule: Present ideas in a logical progression that builds from basic concepts to advanced ones.
checks: Do later concepts require earlier ones that are already taught?

principles.name: Hierarchical page layouts
principles.rule: Make content hierarchy obvious through heading styles/sizes, prominent placement of key info, and whitespace.
checks: Can a learner scan and instantly see structure and priority?

principles.name: Structural cues
principles.rule: Use labels, intros, headings, and signaling to show what matters and why.
checks: Are learners guided on what to focus on and why?

principles.name: Standardized features
principles.rule: Use consistent palettes, fonts, layouts, and standardized UI conventions.
checks: Do screens behave consistently across the course?

principles.name: Integrated format
principles.rule: Keep instruction, practice, assessment, and resources in one integrated channel to reduce toggling load.
checks: Are learners forced to jump between tools/screens unnecessarily?

principles.name: Program continuity
principles.rule: Ensure concept and skill development continues coherently across stages of a program.
checks: Do later modules build on earlier ones with consistent expectations?

principles.name: Clear, measurable learning objectives
principles.rule: Make objectives visible, clear, and measurable.
checks: Can a learner tell what success looks like?

principles.name: Openers and closers
principles.rule: Start units with an orienting opener and end with a summary to reinforce consolidation.
checks: Does every unit begin with orientation and end with consolidation?

principles.name: Lesson alignment
principles.rule: Align instruction, practice, and assessments to the objectives.
checks: Is every activity clearly tied to an objective?

principles.name: Expectation setting
principles.rule: Explain how completion is recognized and what is expected.
checks: Are expectations explicit (time, quality, grading, outcomes)?

principles.name: Course introductions
principles.rule: Provide overview: description, structure, policies, and prerequisites.
checks: Are prerequisites and structure clearly communicated?

principles.name: Spaced exposure over time
principles.rule: Revisit key concepts after weeks/months to strengthen retention.
checks: Is there planned re-exposure later in the program?

principles.name: Learner control
principles.rule: Let learners choose order/pace and provide shortcuts for experienced users.
checks: Can experienced learners move faster without losing coherence?

pillars.name: Active, Engaging Learning Content
pillars.goal: Use multimedia + meaningful activities so learners think, respond, and apply knowledge (not just read).

principles.name: Streamlined content
principles.rule: Succinct, uncluttered content focused on objectives.

principles.name: Visual content
principles.rule: Use visual + verbal (purposeful multimedia), not text-only.

principles.name: Minimal decorative graphics
principles.rule: Avoid purely decorative images; keep graphics relevant.

principles.name: Closely placed text and graphics
principles.rule: Place related text and visuals near each other.

principles.name: Scannable text
principles.rule: Use short paragraphs, headings, lists, and visual breaks.

principles.name: Progressive disclosures
principles.rule: Layer information; reveal details on demand (e.g., accordions).

principles.name: Direct access
principles.rule: Provide in-page links/accordions to jump to what’s relevant.

principles.name: Legibility and audibility
principles.rule: Readable fonts; audio must be clearly audible.

principles.name: Multimedia-rich content
principles.rule: Use video/animations/interactives/audio to increase appeal and learning.

principles.name: Activity-based content
principles.rule: Prioritize doing and meaningful interaction over long passive text.

principles.name: Short videos
principles.rule: Keep videos under ~10 minutes; segment longer videos.

principles.name: Video narration
principles.rule: Use narration to explain visuals instead of relying on text.

principles.name: On-screen text in videos
principles.rule: Use text sparingly; avoid repeating narration verbatim.

principles.name: Audio-visual synchronization
principles.rule: Present corresponding audio and visuals simultaneously.

principles.name: Social presence
principles.rule: Use friendly, conversational language and narration.

principles.name: Explaining features
principles.rule: Explain how tools/features support objectives and benefit learners.

principles.name: Activating prior knowledge
principles.rule: Start with questions/scenarios that connect to learner experience.

principles.name: Storytelling
principles.rule: Use narrative elements (characters, conflict, arcs) when useful.

principles.name: Concreteness fading
principles.rule: Start with concrete examples, then move to abstraction.

principles.name: Appropriate leveling
principles.rule: Aim for intermediate difficulty: neither trivial nor overwhelming.

principles.name: Interest and relevance
principles.rule: Use relevant, interesting examples tied to learner context.

principles.name: Key terms
principles.rule: Highlight/define key concepts and glossary terms aligned to objectives.

principles.name: Varied examples and perspectives
principles.rule: Provide multiple contexts and perspectives; compare similarities/differences.

principles.name: Additional resources
principles.rule: Provide supplementary resources (guides, links, etc.).

principles.name: Currency and accuracy
principles.rule: Ensure content is current, accurate, and properly sourced.

principles.name: Inclusivity
principles.rule: Avoid bias, stereotyping, and discrimination.

principles.name: Conveying credibility
principles.rule: Show credibility indicators: author credentials, dates, reputable sources.

pillars.name: Continuous Practice & Feedback
pillars.goal: Strengthen memory and understanding via varied practice and immediate, useful feedback.

principles.name: Varied practice
principles.rule: Use varied instances/contexts for the same skill.

principles.name: Interleaving practice
principles.rule: Mix related skills/concepts rather than blocking one at a time.

principles.name: Spaced practice
principles.rule: Cycle back to the same skills over extended time.

principles.name: Effortful practice
principles.rule: Use recall-heavy prompts (short answer, fill-in) when appropriate.

principles.name: Authentic practice
principles.rule: Reflect real-world contexts learners will face.

principles.name: Low-stakes practice
principles.rule: Provide ungraded practice to learn from mistakes.

principles.name: Practicing prior skills
principles.rule: Warm up key prerequisites before introducing new topics.

principles.name: Targeted feedback
principles.rule: Specific, goal-oriented feedback with actionable next steps.

principles.name: Encouraging feedback
principles.rule: Positive tone; celebrate progress; reduce threat.

principles.name: Immediate feedback
principles.rule: Deliver feedback right after submission.

principles.name: Worked examples
principles.rule: Provide worked examples then fade to partial and independent solving.

principles.name: Clear instructions
principles.rule: Rubrics + clear expectations for activities/assessments.

principles.name: Self-assessing progress
principles.rule: Help learners accurately judge progress and plan study time.

principles.name: Generating explanations
principles.rule: Ask why/how/what-if to elicit higher-order thinking.

principles.name: Reflection
principles.rule: Prompt reflection on what/how they learned.

principles.name: Social learning
principles.rule: Enable collaboration and discussion when appropriate.

pillars.name: Simple, Intuitive User Experience
pillars.goal: Reduce friction so learners spend cognitive energy on learning, not navigation.

principles.name: Intuitive navigation
principles.rule: Minimize wasted effort with clear navigation.

principles.name: Progress and location indicators
principles.rule: Show learner location/progress to aid motivation and time management.

principles.name: Differentiate static vs. interactive
principles.rule: Make clickable/interactive elements clearly recognizable.

principles.name: Closed learning system
principles.rule: Keep experience self-contained; clearly label external links.

principles.name: Resume where you left off
principles.rule: Support returning learners in finding their place quickly.

principles.name: Simple and advanced search
principles.rule: Support finding specifics within lessons.

principles.name: Note-taking and highlighting
principles.rule: Provide annotation tools.

principles.name: Viewability on different screen sizes
principles.rule: Responsive design; reflowable text; zoomable graphics.

principles.name: Customizing display preferences
principles.rule: Allow font/size/background customization.

principles.name: Minimalist design
principles.rule: Prioritize clarity and simplicity in UX/UI.

principles.name: Controlling the pace of videos
principles.rule: Give controls to replay/speed/slow/skip.

principles.name: Time estimates
principles.rule: Provide time estimates and timestamps for media.
